info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 11:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN MASON, ROBERTSON, BRACKEN, EASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTH CENTRAL CLERMONT AND WEST CENTRAL BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1126 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Butler to near Cynthiana, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Brooksville, Mount Olivet, Higginsport, Germantown, Sardis, Neville, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Blue Licks Battlefield, Browning Corner, Willow Grove, Bradford, Burika, Alhambra, Stonewall, Mitchells Mill, Powersville, Johnsville and Utopia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
